sentences.en: "Some six months later," Freud writes, "Hans had got over his jealousy."
sentences.cn: “大约6个月后，”弗洛伊德写道，“汉斯克服了他的嫉妒心理。”

sentences.en: A dark jealousy stirred in his bosom.
sentences.cn: 他内心生出一阵恶毒的嫉妒.

sentences.en: He quickly discovered the petty jealousies and gossip of village life.
sentences.cn: 他很快就发现，在乡村生活中，人们狭隘善妒，喜欢传播流言蜚语。

sentences.en: I can't support your jealousy any longer.
sentences.cn: 我再也无法忍受你的嫉妒了.

sentences.en: Maybe there is jealousy, but I think the envy is more powerful.
sentences.cn: 也许是羡慕，但我认为更多的是嫉妒。

sentences.en: Sexual jealousy is a common motive for murder.
sentences.cn: 性嫉妒是常见的谋杀动机。

sentences.en: She gave vent to her anger and jealousy.
sentences.cn: 她宣泄了自己的愤怒和嫉妒。

sentences.en: Suspicion and jealousy, however ill-founded, can poison a marriage.
sentences.cn: 怀疑和忌妒，不管多么站不住脚，都可能毒害婚姻。

sentences.en: That kind of jealousy doesn't bother me.
The letter made her insane with jealousy.
sentences.cn: 那封信使她妒忌得发疯.

sentences.en: They are consumed with jealousy at her success.
sentences.cn: 他们对她的成功充满了嫉妒。

sentences.en: When self-esteem is high, we lose our mortal fear of jealousy.
sentences.cn: 自信心很强时，我们不再对妒忌感到极度惧怕。

words.tran_cn: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的

trans.tran_cn: 妒忌，猜忌，戒备，小心提防
